verses.roman:
āṭānna ca-kārera saba lopa haya
eka ātmārāma-śabde āṭānna artha kaya

synonyms: āṭānna—fifty-eight; ca-kārera—of the additions of the word ca; saba lopa haya—all of them are rejected; eka—one; ātmārāma—ātmārāma; śabde—by the word; āṭānna artha kaya—fifty-eight imports are automatically derived.
translation: "When all the ca-kāra, or additions to the word ca, are taken away, fifty-eight different meanings can still be understood by the one word ātmārāma.
